Research Citation Manager

• A single-file Python 3 CLI app for organizing, tagging, and retrieving research paper metadata and notes.

• Core Features:
  - Add papers with title, authors, URL, publication year, and custom tags
  - Full-text search across titles, authors, and tags
  - View all papers sorted by year (descending) or alphabetically
  - Add/edit notes per paper (multi-line text)
  - Export entire library to JSON (human-readable format)
  - Import papers from JSON file to merge libraries
  - Delete papers with confirmation prompt
  - List all unique tags with paper counts

• Data Persistence:
  - Store all papers and notes in a JSON file (default: research_library.json) in the user's home directory
  - Auto-load library on startup; create empty library if file doesn't exist

• Keyboard-First UX:
  - Menu-driven interface with single-letter commands (a=add, s=search, l=list, n=notes, e=export, i=import, d=delete, q=quit)
  - Tab navigation through input fields
  - Arrow keys to cycle through search results
  - Ctrl+C gracefully exits

• Undo/Redo:
  - Maintain a 20-action history stack (add, delete, edit notes)
  - u=undo, r=redo commands in main menu
  - Clear history on export/import

• Accessibility:
  - Clear prompts and error messages
  - Screen-reader friendly output (plain text, no ANSI colors)
  - Help command (h) displays all keyboard shortcuts

• Standard Library Only:
  - Use json for persistence
  - Use pathlib for file paths
  - Use datetime for timestamps
  - Use sys/argparse for CLI arguments (optional: --config-path flag)
